intro: Cissus wrightiana, commonly known as the climbing hedgeplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Vitaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, including Kenya, Tanzania, and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit, with tendrils that help it attach to supports. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and greenish-white in color. Cissus wrightiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
